lead_paragraph: Kirby Puckett’s cremated remains were awarded to his children. Puckett, who had a Hall of Fame career with the Minnesota Twins, died in March at age 45 after a stroke. His body was cremated in the Twin Cities and the ashes were kept by a funeral home. Puckett’s fiancée, Jodi Olson, sought the ashes, saying she wanted some of them for a locket. The couple were living together in Scottsdale, Ariz., when he died.
